name: bearishly
content:
bearishly adverb
(ANIMAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that looks or behaves like a bear: He had wavy brown hair with whiskers that bearishly covered his cheeks. I tried nudging him to wake him up, but he only growled bearishly and pulled the covers over his head.
More examplesFewer examplesAfter putting out the bins , he plodded bearishly back towards his house.
bearishly adverb
(FINANCE)
finance & economics
  specialized in a way that suggests that you expect prices to fall: Short-term speculators have been bearishly aligned with the stock in recent weeks. The market has responded to silver bearishly but is more bullish on gold.
